googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.vbmAbsenteeBallotRules: Any registered Pennsylvania can request an absentee ballot ballot and vote by mail.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.idRequirementsOvr: You can register to vote online if you have a Pennsylvania driver's license or state ID card. If not, you can still register to vote by mail or in person.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.idRequirementsSdr: Bring your Pennsylvania driver's license or state ID card with you. If you don't have one, bring ONE photo ID that shows your name, and ONE document that shows your name and current address.  Acceptable documents include a utility bill, bank statement, paycheck, residential lease, or any government document that shows your name and address.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.registrationRules:
To register in Pennsylvania you must:

  * be a citizen of the United States at least one month before the next election
  * be a resident of Pennsylvania and your election district at least 30 days before Election Day
  * be at least 18 years of age on the day of the next election
  * not be incarcerated after conviction for a felony (your voting rights are restored immediately after incarceration)
